page.title: 02DHSS - THE SITE
page.content:
THE DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND SOCIAL SECURITY:
It is the biggest office in the Western World.
The site covers an area of 65 acres and contains one and a half million square feet of office space. It was completed by 1948 and German prisoners of war helped to build some of the foundations.
Each day 8.5 thousand people go to work there and the catering staff run 4 restaurants and various cafeterias.
They have their own Bakery, Bank, Post Office and Surgery (with four full-time nurses). They have their own clubs, sports grounds and social activities.
